elements.name: Message Profile Identifier
elements.description: Message Profile Identifiers provide a literal value to use for the references in MSH-21.  MSH-21 will always contain a reference to the notification type in the "PHINProfileID" namespace and a reference to the implemented version of the Generic MMG in the "PHINMsgMapID" namespace.  For conditions that have a condition-specific MMG, MSH-21 will also contain a reference to that MMG that is also in the "PHINMsgMapID" namespace.

hl7v251.messageContext: MSH-21 Message Profile ID
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
CONFORMANCE STATEMENT: Message Profile ID (MSH-21) for this version of the MMG SHALL contain the literal value: ‘NOTF_ORU_v3.0^PHINProfileID^2.16.840.1.114222.4.10.3^ISO~Generic_MMG_V2.0^PHINMsgMapID^2.16.840.1.114222.4.10.4^ISO~Hepatitis_MMG_V1.0^PHINMsgMapID^2.16.840.1.114222.4.10.4^ISO'

Refer to Conformance Statement CN-009 and CN-010 in the National Condition Reporting Case Notification Message Structure Specification\Profile Version 3.0, Release 1.

blocks.name: Epidemiologic Information
blocks.startingDescription: START: EPIDEMIOLOGIC INFORMATION SECTION: The observations in this section will be mapped under a "Epidemiologic Information" category OBR segment with an OBR-4 value of '68991-9^Epidemiologic Information^LN'

elements.name: Reason for Testing
elements.description: Listing of the reason(s) the subject was tested for Hepatitis. If "Other" has been selected as coded value, specify the free text using "Other Reason for Testing"  data element.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=67098-4
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|nn|CWE|67098-4^Reason for Testing^LN||PHC309^Evaluation of elevated liver enzymes^CDCPHINVS||||||F

elements.name: Other Reason for Testing
elements.description: Other reason(s) the subject was tested for Hepatitis (Free text).

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV901
OBX-5=string up to 199 characters
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|nn|ST|INV901^Other Reason for Testing^PHINQUESTION||Lost original sample||||||F

elements.name: Symptomatic
elements.description: Was the subject symptomatic for Hepatitis.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV576
OBX-5=value from value set

elements.name: Jaundiced (Symptom)
elements.description: Was the subject jaundiced.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV578
OBX-5=value from value set

elements.name: Due Date
elements.description: Subject's pregnancy due date.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=11778-8
OBX-5=date

elements.name: Previously Aware of Condition
elements.description: Was the subject aware they had Hepatitis prior to lab testing.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV650
OBX-5=value from value set

elements.name: Provider of Care for Condition
elements.description: Does the subject have a provider of care for Hepatitis? This is any healthcare provider that monitors or treats the patient for viral Hepatitis.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV651
OBX-5=value from value set

elements.name: Diabetes
elements.description: Does subject have diabetes?

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV887
OBX-5=value from value set

elements.name: Diabetes Diagnosis Date
elements.description: If subject has diabetes, date of diabetes diagnosis?

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV842
OBX-5=date

blocks.name: Interpretative Liver Enzyme Testing Repeating Group
blocks.startingDescription: START: Interpretative Liver Enzyme Testing Repeating Group
blocks.endingDescription: END: Interpretative Liver Enzyme Testing Repeating Group

elements.name: ALT/SGPT (LN)
elements.description: ALT/SGPT (LN)

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=1742-6
OBX-4=obs sub-id
OBX-5.2=numeric result
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the test result (INV850) for the liver enzyme test type (INV825).  There may also be INV827 and INV826 data elements associated with this lab result.

elements.name: AST/SGOT (LN)
elements.description: AST/SGOT (LN)

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=1920-8
OBX-4=obs sub-id
OBX-5.2=numeric result
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the test result (INV850) for the liver enzyme test type (INV825).  There may also be INV827 and INV826 data elements associated with this lab result.

elements.name: Liver Enzyme Upper Limit Normal
elements.description: Liver Enzyme Upper Limit Normal.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV827
OBX-4=obs sub-id
OBX-5.2=numeric result

elements.name: Liver Enzyme Test Result Date
elements.description: Liver Enzyme Test Result Date.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=INV826
OBX-4=obs sub-id
OBX-5=date

elements.name: total anti-HAV
elements.description: Hepatitis A virus Ab

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38316-3
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: IgM anti-HAV
elements.description: Hepatitis A virus IgM

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38318-9
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: total anti-HBc
elements.description: Hepatitis B virus core Ab

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38323-9
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: IgM anti-HBc
elements.description: Hepatitis B virus Core IgM

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38325-4
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: HEP B Nucleic Acid Test (NAT)
elements.description: Hepatitis B virus DNA

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38320-5
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: HBeAg
elements.description: Hepatitis B virus e Ag

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38329-6
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: HBsAg
elements.description: Hepatitis B virus surface Ag

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38331-2
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: total anti-HCV
elements.description: Hepatitis C virus Ab

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38332-0
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290). 

Populate the "Anti-HCV signal to cut-off ratio (INV841)"

elements.name: Supplemental anti-HCV assay (RIBA)
elements.description: Hepatitis C virus Ab in Serum by Immunoblot

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=5199-5
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: HCV RNA
elements.description: Hepatitis C virus RNA

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38335-3
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: total anti-HDV
elements.description: Hepatitis D virus Ab

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38345-2
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: total anti-HEV
elements.description: Hepatitis E virus Ab

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=LP38350-2
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the interpretative result (INV291) for the test type (INV290).

elements.name: Anti-HCV signal to cut-off ratio

OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=48159-8
OBX-5=string up to 199 characters
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This is the anti-HCV signal to cut-off ratio (INV841).

blocks.name: Laboratory Information
blocks.startingDescription: START: LABORATORY INFORMATION SECTION: The observations in this section will be mapped under a "Laboratory Information" category OBR segment with an OBR-4 value of '30954-2^Laboratory Information^LN'

blocks.name: [Optional/Preferred] Laboratory Template - Note That Everything In The Laboratory Template Represents One Order_Observation Group In The Message.
blocks.startingDescription: START: [Optional/Preferred] Laboratory Template - Note that everything in the laboratory template represents one ORDER_OBSERVATION Group in the message.

elements.name: Placer Order Number
elements.description: A unique order number that uniquely identifies an order among all orders from an ordering application

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-2=placer order number

elements.name: Filler Order Number
elements.description: A laboratory generated number that identifies the test/order instance

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-3=filler order number

elements.name: Test Ordered Name
elements.description: Test that was ordered by the physician / provider (Example: a lab test panel which would lead to several lab tests)

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-4=value from value set

elements.name: Observation Date/Time
elements.description: The clinically relevant date/time of the observation

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-7=date

elements.name: Specimen Action Code
elements.description: The action to be taken with respect to the specimens that accompany or precede this order

hl7v251.messageContext: OBR segment with OBR-11=Value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
The value of 'G' indicates "Generated order; reflex order". 

If 'G' value is provided OBR-26 and OBR-29 SHOULD be populated. (refer to ELR implementation guide for more details)

elements.name: Ordering Provider
elements.description: The physician / provider who ordered the test

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-16=ordering provider

elements.name: Results Rpt/Status Chng - Date/Time
elements.description: Indicates the date and time that the results were reported or that a status changed

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-22=date

elements.name: Result Status
elements.description: The status of results for this order

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-25=value from value set

elements.name: Parent Result
elements.description: Used together with the information in OBR-29 (Parent), to uniquely identify the parent result's OBX segment related to this order

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-26=parent result
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBR-26 is used with OBR-29 Parent to link a specific OBX segment associated with another OBR segment, used primarily for linking susceptibility tests to parent culture. Also, commonly used for reflex testing.

elements.name: Parent
elements.description: Relates a child to its parent when a parent/child relationship exists

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-29=parent
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBR-29 is used to link the OBR with a parent OBR, commonly used to link susceptibility results with the parent culture. Also, commonly used for reflex testing.

elements.name: Reason for Study
elements.description: Reason for the study

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-31=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBR-31 uses values from various code systems for that reason they are not referenced directly. Commonly used code systems: ICD9, ICD10, and CPT

elements.name: Parent Universal Service Identifier
elements.description: The identifier code for the parent order, which caused this observation/test/battery to be performed

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBR segment with
OBR-50=Parent universal service identifier
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBR-50 optionally allowed for Labs that do not support unique placer or filler order numbers. In this case for parent/child result linking OBR-29 will need to be populated.

elements.name: Test Performed Name
elements.description: The lab test or analysis that was performed on the specimen (also referred as "Resulted Test Name")

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
The OBX segments in an associated laboratory report may use OBX-4 Obs Sub-ID if there is a need to uniquely identify where OBX-3 Observation Identifier is re-used.  Typical parsing rules will apply if OBX-4 is detected.

"PHVS_LabTestName_CDC" is the broader VADS value set from the Electronic Laboratory Reporting (ELR) to Public Health - HL7 Version 2.5.1 (ELR)  that contains all the lab tests.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|CWE|13950-1^Hepatitis A virus IgM Ab [Presence] in Serum by Immunoassay^LN|1|10828004^Positive^SCT||Negative|POS|||F|||20140225|||0101^Immunoassay^OBSMETHOD||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Observation Sub-ID
elements.description: Distinguishes between multiple OBX segments with the same observation ID organized under one OBR

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-4=numeric value up to 20 characters
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBX-4 is used to group related observations.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|CWE|13950-1^Hepatitis A virus IgM Ab [Presence] in Serum by Immunoassay^LN|1|10828004^Positive^SCT||Negative|POS|||F|||20140225|||0101^Immunoassay^OBSMETHOD||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Result - Coded Qualitative (Non-organism)
elements.description: Coded qualitative test result value where OBX-2 is CE or CWE value type

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=value from value set for Test Performed Name
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
"PHVS_LabTestResultQualitative_CDC" is the broader VADS value set from ELR that contains wide range of coded qualitative results.

"PHVS_QualLabResult_RCMT" is the value set from the Reportable Condition Mapping Tables (RCMT) Project which contains commonly used positive, negative and inconclusive qualitative test results associated with infectious diseases.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|CWE|13950-1^Hepatitis A virus IgM Ab [Presence] in Serum by Immunoassay^LN||10828004^Positive^SCT||Negative|POS|||F|||20140225|||0101^Immunoassay^OBSMETHOD||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Result - Coded Organism
elements.description: Coded result, where result is a coded organism (SNOMED) and OBX-2 is CE or CWE value type

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=value from value set for Test Performed Name
OBX-5=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: "PHVS_Microorganism_CDC" is the broader VADS value set from ELR that contains all the lab result organisms.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|CWE|49883-2^Hepatitis B virus resistance panel by Genotype method^LN||703892007^Hepatitis B virus genotype G (organism)^SCT||||||F|||20140225|||||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Result - Numeric
elements.description: Numeric result value, used where OBX-2 is SN or NM value type

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=value from value set for Test Performed Name
If OBX-2=SN: 
OBX-5=numeric value (see SN data type)
If OBX-2=NM:
OBX-5=numeric value
OBX-6=units value from LAB115 value set
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|1742-6^Alanine aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma^LN^SALT^Serum ALT^L^2.40^V1||=^65|U/L^enzyme unit per liter^UCUM|7-56 units per liter of serum|H|||F|||20120806|||0262^Spectrophotometry^OBSMETHOD

elements.name: Units of Measure
elements.description: Numeric result value units, used where OBX-2 is SN or NM value type

hl7v251.identifier: N/A: OBX-6 for Test Result - Numeric
hl7v251.messageContext: OBX-6 Units for OBX segment identified by Test Result - Numeric
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|1742-6^Alanine aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma^LN^SALT^Serum ALT^L^2.40^V1||=^65|U/L^enzyme unit per liter^UCUM|7-56 units per liter of serum|H|||F|||20120806|||0262^Spectrophotometry^OBSMETHOD

elements.name: Test Result - Text
elements.description: Lab result text value, used value type where result is neither numeric nor coded and OBX-2 is TX value type

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=value from value set for Test Performed Name
OBX-5=string with undefined max length
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|TX|13950-1^Hepatitis A virus IgM Ab [Presence] in Serum by Immunoassay^LN||positive||||||F|||20140225|||0101^Immunoassay^OBSMETHOD||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Result - Encapsulated Data
elements.description:
Encapsulated Data result value, used where OBX-2 is ED value type

Supported to allow sending of encapsulated data such as images or PDF files associated with lab report, commonly Base64 encoded.

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-3.1=data format type
OBX-5=string with undefined max length
hl7v251.implementationNotes: This data type transmits encapsulated data from a source system to a destination system. It contains the identity of the source system, the type of data, the encoding method of the data, and the data itself.

elements.name: Unique identifier for Current sample
elements.description: Unique isolate identifier for current sample

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with 
OBX-3.1=80398-1
OBX-5=the isolate identifier assigned by the laboratory
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Optional OBX for capturing isolate identifiers.

The isolate identifier of the sample being tested. Typically the Isolate ID from the Specimen ID Filler Assigned Identifier,  SPM-2.2.

elements.name: Test Result - Reference Range
elements.description: Identifies the upper and lower limits or bounds of test result values

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-7=string up to 60 characters
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|1742-6^Alanine aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma^LN^SALT^Serum ALT^L^2.40^V1||=^65|U/L^enzyme unit per liter^UCUM|7-56 units per liter of serum|H|||F|||20120806|||0262^Spectrophotometry^OBSMETHOD

elements.name: Test Result -Interpretation Flag
elements.description:
Abnormal flags used for laboratory result interpretation by the lab (not epidemiologist's interpretation). 
The interpretation flag identifies a result that is not typical as well as how its not typical. Examples: susceptible, resistant, normal, above upper panic limits, below absolute low

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-8=value from value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBX-8 in ELR is noted to have pre-adopted the CWE datatype.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|1742-6^Alanine aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma^LN^SALT^Serum ALT^L^2.40^V1||=^65|U/L^enzyme unit per liter^UCUM|7-56 units per liter of serum|H|||F|||20120806|||0262^Spectrophotometry^OBSMETHOD

elements.name: Observation Result Status
elements.description: Result status is the degree of completion of the lab test

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-11=value from value set
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|CWE|51660-9^Hepatitis A virus IgM Ab [Presence] in Body fluid^LN||10828004^Positive^SCT||Negative|POS|||F|||20140225|||0101^Immunoassay^OBSMETHOD||20140226||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Specimen Collection Date
elements.description: Date/time of observation in OBX segment for ELR infers the specimen collection date

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-14=date
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|11011-4^Hepatitis C virus RNA [Units/volume] (viral load) in Serum or Plasma by Probe and target amplification method^LN||^20400||Not detected||||F|||20140117|||0132^Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)^OBSMETHOD||20140118||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Method
elements.description: The technique or method used to perform the test and obtain the test results (Examples: serum neutralization, titration, dipstick, test strip, anaerobic culture)

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-17=value from value set
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|11011-4^Hepatitis C virus RNA [Units/volume] (viral load) in Serum or Plasma by Probe and target amplification method^LN||^20400||Not detected||||F|||20140117|||0132^Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)^OBSMETHOD||20140118||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Specimen Analyzed Date
elements.description: Date/time associated with generation of the result

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-19=date
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|11011-4^Hepatitis C virus RNA [Units/volume] (viral load) in Serum or Plasma by Probe and target amplification method^LN||^20400||Not detected||||F|||20140117|||0132^Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)^OBSMETHOD||20140118||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Performing Laboratory Name
elements.description: Name of laboratory that performed the lab test

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-23.1=string up to 50 characters
hl7v251.implementationNotes: OBX-23.1 in ELR is a 50 character string representing performing organization name
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|11011-4^Hepatitis C virus RNA [Units/volume] (viral load) in Serum or Plasma by Probe and target amplification method^LN||^20400||Not detected||||F|||20140117|||0132^Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)^OBSMETHOD||20140118||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Performing Person Name
elements.description: Performing organization medical director / performing person name

hl7v251.messageContext:
OBX segment with
OBX-25=performing organization medical director
hl7v251.sampleSegment: OBX|1|SN|11011-4^Hepatitis C virus RNA [Units/volume] (viral load) in Serum or Plasma by Probe and target amplification method^LN||^20400||Not detected||||F|||20140117|||0132^Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)^OBSMETHOD||20140118||||GHH Lab^L^^^^CLIA&2.16.840.1.113883.19.4.6&ISO^XX^^^1236||9876543^^^^^^^^NPI&1.3.6.1.4.1.562.2.4.1.43&ISO^^^^NPI

elements.name: Test Result Comments
elements.description: The notes and comment related to the result being reported in the OBX segment (Examples: information amplifying the reference range provided, comments about how a clinical finding was reached, clarification regarding the meaning of a clinical finding, additional information not directly related to the clinical finding such as contact information for the lab, disclaimers, etc., most canned, or boiler plate text associated with a result falls into the comment category)

hl7v251.messageContext:
NTE segment with
NTE-3=string with undefined max length
hl7v251.usage: R if the NTE segment is used
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Multiple NTE segments following the OBX may be used to convey result notes.  NTE-1 Set ID is used to keep them in order.
hl7v251.sampleSegment: NTE|1|L|Result in log IU/mL is 4.31.The quantification range of this assay is 15 to 100,000,000 IU/mL (1.18 log to 8.00 log IU/mL). Testing was performed by the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV Test, version 2.0 (Roche Molecular Systems, Inc.)

elements.name: Specimen ID
elements.description: A laboratory generated number that identifies the specimen related to this test

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-2.1=placer assigned specimen ID
SPM-2.2=filler assigned specimen ID

elements.name: Specimen ID Placer Assigned Identifier
elements.description: Specimen ID placer assigned identifier

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-2.1=placer assigned specimen ID

elements.name: Specimen ID Filler Assigned Identifier
elements.description: Specimen ID filler assigned identifier

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-2.2=filler assigned specimen ID

elements.name: Specimen Type
elements.description: The type of specimen used in testing the resulted lab test

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-4=value from value set
hl7v251.usage: R if the SPM segment is used

elements.name: Specimen Source Site
elements.description: This indicates the physical location of the subject where the specimen originated (Examples: right internal jugular, left arm, buttock, right eye)

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-8=value from value set

elements.name: Specimen Role
elements.description: Indicates the role of the sample

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-11=value from value set

elements.name: Specimen Collection Amount
elements.description: Specifies the volume or mass of the collected specimen

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-12.1=numeric value
SPM-12.2=units value from UCUM value set
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Units for lab test in SPM-12.2 would be using UCUM code system.  UCUM provides syntax . UCUM value sets are available in VADS which includes commonly used units from LOINC website.

elements.name: Specimen Description
elements.description: Text description of the specimen

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-14=string up to 199 characters

elements.name: Specimen Collection Date/Time
elements.description: The date the specimen was collected

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-17.1=date

elements.name: Specimen Received Date/Time
elements.description: The date/time the specimen is received

hl7v251.messageContext:
SPM segment with
SPM-18=date
